title: Getting Started with JavaScript
description: Learn the basics of JavaScript programming language

subtopics.title: What is JavaScript?
subtopics.content:
JavaScript is a high-level, interpreted programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification. It is a language that is also characterized as dynamic, weakly typed, prototype-based and multi-paradigm.

JavaScript enables interactive web pages and is an essential part of web applications. The vast majority of websites use it, and all major web browsers have a dedicated JavaScript engine to execute it.
subtopics.codeExample:
// This is a JavaScript comment
console.log('Hello, World!'); // Prints to browser console

subtopics.title: Variables and Data Types
subtopics.content:
Variables are containers for storing data values. In JavaScript, you can declare variables using three keywords: var, let, and const.

JavaScript has several data types:
- Number: integer or floating point numbers
- String: sequence of characters
- Boolean: true or false
- Object: for more complex data structures
- Undefined: a variable that has not been assigned a value
- Null: represents no value
subtopics.codeExample:
// Variable declarations
let message = 'Hello'; // String
const pi = 3.14; // Number
var isActive = true; // Boolean

// Different data types
let age = 25; // Number
let name = 'John'; // String
let isStudent = false; // Boolean
let person = {firstName: 'John', age: 25}; // Object

subtopics.title: Operators
subtopics.content:
Operators are used to perform operations on variables and values.

**Arithmetic Operators**: +, -, *, /, %, ++, --
**Assignment Operators**: =, +=, -=, *=, /=
**Comparison Operators**: ==, ===, !=, !==, >, <, >=, <=
**Logical Operators**: &&, ||, !
